dt: {bc}showing innocent or childlike simplicity and candidness

pt: {sc}natural{/sc} {sc}ingenuous{/sc} {sc}naive{/sc} {sc}unsophisticated{/sc} {sc}artless{/sc} mean free from pretension or calculation. {sc}natural{/sc} implies lacking artificiality and self-consciousness and having a spontaneousness suggesting the natural rather than the man-made world.
{sc}ingenuous{/sc} implies inability to disguise or conceal one's feelings or intentions.
{sc}naive{/sc} suggests lack of worldly wisdom often connoting credulousness and unchecked innocence.
{sc}unsophisticated{/sc} implies a lack of experience and training necessary for social ease and adroitness.
{sc}artless{/sc} suggests a naturalness resulting from unawareness of the effect one is producing on others.

et: Latin {it}ingenuus{/it} native, freeborn, from {it}in-{/it} + {it}gignere{/it} to beget {ma}{mat|kin|}{/ma}
shortdef: showing innocent or childlike simplicity and candidness
